Interesting character  

The simple reading being  

ğˆ â‹ O â‹ Î© â‹ Ï‰ â‹ WH/HW â‹ Æ• â‹ ğ“‡³  

The simple reading seems so pure and natural:  

ğˆğŒ´ğŒ¹ğ„ğƒ white  

After over a dozen centuries of sound shifts and corruption it became almost imperceivable that the original reading might have been considerably different, albeit anchestral:  

Let us open-mindedly investigate alternative readings:  

ğˆğŒ°ğ‚[ğŒ¾](ğŒ¾.html)ğŒ¹ğƒ	> welches	which,what

While the last reading seems too far off, ğˆ having a t component is less xenobic for people familiar with the strange sounds humans are capable of producing. In fact the chinese "Quetschlaute" j,q,x have a dangling áµˆáµŸáµ—

ğŒ°ğ†ğˆğŒ°ğ€ğŒ¾ğŒ°ğŒ½  abwÃ¼rpgen > abwÃ¼rgen

ğŒ°ğ†ğˆğŒ°ğ€ğŒ¾ğŒ°ğŒ½  ab.qvanpjen > quench off (with ğŒ° aâ‡¨aÃ­n)
